W-well, th thank you!

Don't ever be afraid to come to me with stuff like that. The simple fact that you actually seem to give a crap is the reason I took an interest in you to begin with. It's why I trust you as a doctor. Hell, it's...it's why I trust you as a person.
Are you dying?
I've got a new shrink.
Aw, just say it.
You know, Dr. Cox, I wanna thank you for this whole year
Oh, no, no, no...no.
And I just wanna know...if I can buy you dinner.
That'd be terrific.
Great! I'm off in, like, a half hour

Oh, no. Here, I was led to believe that you were doing a gift certificate kind of thing. But, to sit and eat...with you, that's-that's just...that's crazy talk! I have half a mind to issue you a drug test. I mean, come on, what'd I sign up for
Would have been nice.
Well, he doesn't have insurance, so if you could talk to the other members of the board today at the meeting, well, J.D. thought maybe we could

J.D. thought? First he dumps that patient on you, and now he wants you to ask me a favor? Honey, if you don't start saying no to him soon, you're gonna wind up on the losing end of a little game I like to call Hide The Pickle.
Oh! J.D. and I are just colleagues.
Oh, my God; I was just joking, but you actually slept with him, didn't you?
Pff. ...A...little.
Look, I don't know where your mother was when she should have been telling you all these things, but you cannot have sex with someone you care about! Sex is for making babies and revenge.
Well, you're so full of it.
Listen, Stick, if you wanna wipe your nose and pretend that was a sneeze, I will play along. But if you have something to say, say it.

Everybody knows you're still sleeping with Dr. Cox; and it can't be about making babies 'cause you'd probably just end up eating them, anyway. And as for revenge, I'm just not sure that driving to his apartment and pleasuring him while he watches sports on TV is hurting him as much as you might think. So I have to figure that you still care about him, whether you want to admit it or not. And if you lay one finger on me, I'm blowing my rape whistle.
Kiss her.
NEW_SCENE
So you see, Dr. Wen, it's not really a favor - you were supposed to do surgery on Mrs. Beckerman, but she passed away this morning.
Go on.

Yeah, she's dead, and we were hoping that maybe you could keep her name on the roster? And, it's not-we don't wanna do surgery on her. Let's face it, Dr. Wen, we're good - but we're not that good, you know what I'm saying?
No.
Dr. Wen, we're trying to get a patient approved for surgery; we're hoping you can keep the slot open.
Oh, sure. Dr. Turk, next time you need to talk to me, think hard about what you want to say, then send her.
Of course. Thanks Dr. Wen!
See, what happened there was, I knew what you were trying to say despite the exact words you were using; so I tried to help you out, instead of getting all mad at you over nothing.
Right, baby, we both know it's not the same.
You are the dumbest man I ever laid eyes on.
Still.
Didn't hurt! Didn't hurt!
Uh-huh? Tell me if it hurts this time!
NEW_SCENE
So, you want me to approve surgery on a 76-year-old man with no insurance and no life-threatening condition. Young man, I'm curious: what did you think the end result of this conversation would be?
Well, pretty much this, except I'm really invested and so I thought I might try crying a little.
Sport, if crying worked on me, my wife would have her own car by now.
Uh...Bob? I think you should reconsider.
Uh, what's that, Perry? I mean, because that didn't sound like something a team-mate would say. Maybe what you meant to do was pat me on the ass and say, "Go get 'em, Bob."
Right but, what if...we were to look at this from a purely...fiscal perspective.
Did he just say "fiscal"?
I mean, after all, Mr. Bober is here every four to six months, and if we were to consider his surgery as a one-time expenditure, then...you would be making the right financial call.
See, now, that's the kind of thinking I can get behind! How's that make you feel?
Dirty all over.
You get used to it. Boys, I'll do what I can, but if you're gonna pull this off, you're gonna need a board member behind you.
How the hell we supposed to get that?
This is the closest I've come to not hating myself after sleeping with you
Oh, you're just saying that.
Actually, I'm not. I-we connected. What's wrong with you?
Nothing! I guess I was just thinking of a guy I kind of like.
Lemme guess...lemme guess: He is an arrogant, self-hating narcissist who just needs to be loved.
Yeah, pretty much.
Nobody better.
Hey, stud, thank you for not asking me to help out on the Mr. Bober thing.
I would've but, it would have been pointless. It turns out, you're a very predictable woman, there, Jordan.
Puh-lease!

I know you. You're gonna walk into that board room tonight, all tall and strong, and then you're gonna sit back and just pray that nobody asks your opinion. I mean, I'm sure you-you probably think that your little visits here are a spontaneous surprise, but, did you ever wonder why the only two candles that I own are already lit when you walk in that door? I mean, doll, I hate to tell you this but, I don't walk around all day with cologne down in my engine room. I'm not that guy!
Some people like reliability.
In a sedan, it turns out it's terrific. Cheers.
Here's the good news, however: It turns out, it's never too late to turn the whole thing around.
Really....
All you gotta do is stir it up a little bit.
Stir it up?
Stir it right the hell up.
I'll try to remember that.
So I'm guessing, I'll be seeing you in about eleven days, right?
Probably at the exact same time. Don't forget to stir it up, baby.
NEW_SCENE
And so it comes down to this: The hospital board meeting to decide Mr. Bober's fate - and in a weird way, ours, too.
As cheesy as it sounds, I think we knew we were all gonna be okay. Still, I've had this feeling that I'm forgetting something.
Hey, congratulations on becoming a resident. Glad I could help.
Help!?! You were awful to me! You-you-you-you-Awful!
Anyway: Go get 'em, Tiger. The world is your oyster, my friend.
What?
Uh...it's my first day, I'm waiting for someone.
This door is broke, maybe the fifth time or so it don't open.
Maybe there's a paper clip stuck in there?
Why a paper clip?
I was just makin' small talk.
Did you put a paper clip in there?
No.
If I find a paper clip, you're going down.
NEW_SCENE
Here's to the new residents!
Hear, hear.
It's been a long year, but the important thing is we all got through it together. We were a family.
Hey everyone.
Oh, Ms. Sullivan, thank you for helping us with Mr. Bober.
Oh, don't mention it! And even though I wasn't invited to your little party, I brought presents for everyone!
Brace yourself, there, newbie.

Carla, my ex-husband is in love with you. It's true. Ask your boyfriend, he knows; he and Perry talk about it all the time. I don't know why you haven't mentioned this to her! Perhaps you're afraid of something? Huh. And Bob? When are you gonna tell Perry that that promotion you're making him jump through hoops for? was filled months ago! It just seems wrong. Which brings us to Twinkie. If you don't have the courage to tell your 'colleague' Dr. Dorian that you're still crazy about him, I'm gonna go ahead and do it for ya, 'cause that's what friends do. Yeah! And finally, Perry, you are not gonna believe what happened the first time I met your little protg, here....
Oh, please God, no.
I slept with him... and it was good - oh! How's that for stirring things up? Have a great summer, everyone. Bye!
Yep. One big, happy family.
NEW_SCENE
J.D.'s Bedroom Early Day
Yesterday seemed like it would be a good day.... Then it happened.
The Cafeteria
Hey, everyone.
Brace yourself, there, Newbie.
Carla, my ex-husband is in love with you. It's true. Ask your boyfriend, he knows; he and Perry talk about it all the time.
Huh. And Bob? When are you gonna tell Perry that that promotion you're making him jump through hoops for? was filled months ago!
Which brings us to Twinkie.
If you don't have the courage to tell your 'colleague' Dr. Dorian that you're still crazy about him, I'm gonna go ahead and do it for ya, 'cause that's what friends do. Yeah!
And finally: Perry, you are not gonna believe what happened the first time I met your little protg, here....!
Noooooooooooooooooo!
I slept with him...and it was good oh! Bye!
NEW_SCENE
Call it wishful thinking, but I couldn't shake this feeling that this was nothing more than a very, very bad dream.
Good morning, Tiger.
Of course, I've been wrong before.
How could you let a woman kick you out of your own bed?
Baby, why you have to be so cranky in the morning?
This is unacceptable. You said we were gonna sleep head-to-foot.
Dude, either way the naughty bits are still in the middle.
Yeah, but with the head-to-foot alignment, it's just there's no way for them to lock in.
Could you be more homophobic?
Ugh. I'm not!
Ready to go?
Morning, boy.
I can't remember the last time I was in this foul a mood.
Rowdy, no.
Is that supposed to cheer me up? Who would laugh at that?
Yeah, Rowdy! Hit that!
NEW_SCENE
I'm outta here.
Babe....?
I hate it that everything is so messed up between all of us, you know?
Well, just remember what I said to you this morning in bed.
I had my shoes on, it would have been impossible to lock in.
Everything's gonna be fine. Okay? Just be cool.
I'm cool. I'm cool.
The man on the bench launches into Men At Work's "Overkill"
I can't get to sleep / I think about the implications....
What?
Of diving in too deep / And possibly the complications / Especially at night....
Hey.
I worry over situations / I know will be all right / Perhaps it's just imagination....
Day after day it reappears....
Hey, babe, come on, where're you goin'?

column2: He follows after her; and they both pass an orderly pushing a patient in a wheelchair
column3: the troubadour with his guitar.
Night after night my heartbeat shows the fear....
Ghosts appear and fade away....
Oh, God!
Come back another day....
Just keep it down.
Shh!
I can't get to sleep / I think about the implications....
Of diving in too deep / And possibly the complications....
Uhhh....
Especially at night / I worry over situations that / I know will be all right....
Charging!
Clear!
It's just overkill.
Day after day it reappears....
Hey, Elliot....
Night after night my heartbeat shows the fear....
Ghosts appear and fade away....
...Ghosts appear and fade away.....
Nightie-night.
NEW_SCENE
I just wish one of my relationships could be back to normal.
Whoa.... Looks like someone switched to big-boy pants a little too soon.
Ah, that's that's very clever...it looks like I wet myself. Do you actually think that that's funny?
Yeah!
Good God, that's cold!
NEW_SCENE
The Hospital The Hall
Life in a hospital is made up of highs and lows. For instance, my spare pair of scrubs doesn't match, but I put my underwear in the microwave to dry them off, and they feel gooooooooooood.
What are you smiling at?
Could I have Mr. Buckley's chart, please?
No problem. I keep it right down there, in the 'Get it yourself' file.

You know, Bob, I've been thinking about all the times that you've manipulated me and toyed with me, and, well, I can't help but recall that children's fable about the race between the tortoise and the pain-in-the-ass chief of medicine that everybody hates.

You see, Bob, the pain-in-the-ass chief of medicine that everybody hates kept running out in front of the tortoise and taunting him; but right at the end gosh, I'm sure you remember what happened, Bob the tortoise bit clean-through the chief of medicine's calf muscle, dragged him to the ground, where he and all the other turtles devoured him alive, right there on the racetrack. It's a... disturbing children's book, Bob, I know, but it's one that stuck with me, nonetheless.
Buzzy, buzz, buzz....
I...beg your pardon?
Oh, uh, that's the sound of all the bees in your bonnet. And, Perry, even though I could give a rat's ass, I still think it's a pretty sound!
And just like that, it was my turn to face the music.
Steady now.... Be brave.... Don't cry.
Good morning!
What the hell?
Dr. Dorian.
Woo!
Here you go, whiz-kid.
Ooh! Is that my new nickname? 'Cause, you know, I actually thought people were gonna start calling me that in high school when I was in our production of 'The Wiz'....

Yeah, it was the sort of the "hip" version of 'The Wizard of Oz'.... Nipsey Russell played the TinMan? "Come on and ease on down, ease on down the road!" Remember that? No? Well, anyway, you know, kids can be mean and everyone just started calling me "Dorothy." ...High school was hard....
Oh, I'm sorry, sport; I was thinking about soup. Now, Mr. Zerbo was initially admitted with a high fever and suspected meningitis; but, both the NCT and the lumbar puncture came back negative.
Uh...yeah, sir, I have a full patient load; I don't understand that you just drop this guy in my lap and expect me to make him a top priority.
You want me to say "ta da!" so it seems more like a trick? Mr. Zerbo back there is a major hospital benefactor. And, by golly, you know it's a lot harder to write a big, fat check if you're dead.
Neurology, rheumatology, hematology.... This guy's been turfed to every service in the hospital, no one knows what's wrong with him, what do you want me to do?
I hope it's navy bean today.
Dr. Kelso....
Well, gee, sport! I would say you should stop whining, find out what's wrong with him, and treat it; or you can be damn sure I'm going to give you something to whine about.
'Kay, fine! You know.... After all, I'm I'm the Whiz Kid!
Y'are now.
NEW_SCENE
Ladies? Now that The Todd is a resident, he wants to clear things up so you don't have to wonder anymore....
Yes. Yes. No. Yes. No. And...yes if I've been drinking.
Come here, wonderbread.
What's up, doll?
If you ever get this close again, I will end you.
I'm changing you to a "yes" because you're feisty!
Carla, I'm sorry.
For him? Not your fault.
No, I'm talking about us. I'm sorry for what I did wrong.
Which was?
....You know....?
See! You don't even realize why I'm upset. That's
Why are you smiling?
Because I set yo' ass up!
Baby, I shoulda told you how Cox felt about you, and I was wrong for talking behind your back, which is a violation of the trust our relationship is based on. And that is why I'm sorry.
My boy's got mad apologizin' skills!
Todd, not now!
You can't just point out the obvious you have to go deeper.
And Todd, if you say, "That's what she said," I will brain you.
Now, come on, Baby; connect with me why am I really upset?
I'm gonna stick with the violation of trust thing final answer.
Heh!
Yeah, right...
Ohhhhhhhhhhh....
You know, I got half a mind to ask her out.
Too soon?
NEW_SCENE
Well, thanks for the loaners, Chet.
Don't stain 'em.
Once you're a resident here, you get a decent locker. Still, it's a co-ed room, so if you need to change....
...you do it fast.
Dude! That was, like, some sort of record, or something!
Hello!? Hello!?!

Sorry, mom. It's just it's gotten really awkward with this guy that I was seeing and Yes, mom, 'Yay, I'm straight.' Look, I just, I don't know what to do; I mean, every time I see hm, I get so embarrassed, and...lonely, and...mortified.... And I guess I was just hoping that you could Um.... About a hundred-and-fifteen pounds? Phen-fen kills people, mom! B-because I'm a a doctor, that's...how I know.
NEW_SCENE
You look pretty today.
Don't even start with me.
You look horrible?
I look fantastic! And what you're doing, that's starting. I'm pretty sure I said not to start. Laverne?
That's what she said.
It's "don't start" in Spanish.
Bueno.
I had planned to avoid Dr. Cox all day; but, unfortunately, I needed his help.
Dr. Cox, I have this, uh, patient, Mr. Zerbo, I can't quite
Who knows.... Maybe he just decided to let the whole ex-wife thing go.
Auto-immune serologies?
All negative.
Then again, maybe he's just letting me stew for a while.
Bone-marrow biopsy?
Negative.
What kind of man tortures people like this!?!
Afraid you got yourself a toughie.
Okay, fine: I'm sorry I slept with your ex-wife!
I think I'll sit back down.
It was an accident.

Look.... First of all, it's not like you tripped and fell into her...and then out of her...and then into her...again. And, second of all, you're smart enough to know that I don't want to talk about this; I don't want to know where you did it; I don't even want to know...how it was.
A little scary Sorry! Jitters!
And here come the fireworks....
Lookit: I know you didn't have any idea who she was, and I understand why you were too nervous to tell me. So, whatta ya say we leave it at that? I forgive you; you are forgiven. Okay?
Cool!
Damn.
NEW_SCENE
Hospitals aren't as big as you think. Eventually, you run into everyone.
Hey, Elliot.
I'm not I'm not hiding! Um...I just I w I was just looking for my, um...you know the....
I was...looking for my dignity.
Did you find it?
No.
I must have left it at college.
Oh, for God's sakes, would you throw her a rope?
I have no idea how to treat this patient. Help me out.
Now, she's in a really awkward place; so just be sensitive.
I think we should sex each other.
I'm sorry?

Just hear me out: Our relationship ended so quickly, maybe too quickly, you know? And, now there's like these these feelings floating around, and I feel like we're always gonna regret it if we don't...see if they lead somewhere.
What do you think?
I can't believe how weird it feels to be back here again.
Yeah.... But it seems so right.
If Carla's so mad, I don't understand why she doesn't just crash at her own place.
Oh, she is back at her place.
What are you talking about, Willis?
That's pretty funny!
We should make that one of our things.
Yeah, I know.
That's stupid.
I think I'd really panic if she went back to her place.
J.D., this sucks.
Yeah. You know what's weird, though? It's like, Dr. Cox and I are pretty vegan-kosher.
He hasn't yelled at you?
No.
This is the guy that screamed on you for like twenty minutes for dropping a thermometer? And he hasn't raised his voice once about you bumping uglies with his ex-wife?
Mm-mm.
I don't get that guy.
And that's when I realized something....
Hey, where you been? I paged you twice.
Uh...I must have misplaced my pager.
The reason Dr. Cox wasn't yelling at me like he used to...
Huh. Probably ought to try and find that.
...he didn't care about me anymore.
Yep, that's a leaky o-ring. I can fix her...but...I don't got the parts in stock. We need an o-ring down here!
That's entertainment! Whoa.
NEW_SCENE
The Men's Room
Standing there, I couldn't help thinking about the way things used to be....
The Doctors' Lounge
Don't forget, Felicia, if you...
NEW_SCENE
Son, you know you really ought to buy that thing dinner first.
Wha-?
NEW_SCENE
Haunting music plays as everyone moves in slow motion.
And it wasn't just me and Dr. Cox who weren't getting along....
Everyone was just drifting through the halls.
Each one of us acting like the others didn't exist.
That's when I decided to get proactive. And I knew just where to start.
NEW_SCENE
What the bejeezus?
Hello, boys.
What the hell are you doing?
This is how The Todd gets his self-esteem on.
Do these help?
Uncool!
You look totally hot, Mirror Todd.
Hey.
Hey.
You know, Elliot, I think we should talk about the sexual tension
There is no sexual tension, okay!
Just...go ahead and look before your neck snaps.
Awesome!
J.D., the problem is this place. I mean, when we broke up, I had to see you the next day...and the next day. And we never...got any distance from the relationship. I never got...to move on, you know?
And the and the sexual tension.
Oh, my God! You have no idea what you sound like, do you?
J.D.! J.D.! Check it!
Rat-tail!
Yah! Yah! Yah!
You don't wanna play?
NEW_SCENE
Ha! Too slow! What now, Mr. Smart Guy?
That is so not funny.
Wet butt!
It gets better!
Is it starting to burn?!
I would think so.
Hey, uh, don't touch your eyes!
NEW_SCENE
Okay: Right back on the horse.
First off, I'd like to thank you all for agreeing to talk.
Bambi, you paged us here.
Be that as it may, I think there are some simple solutions. Dr. Cox, you're angry with me.
No, I'm not.
And you won't admit this, but you're in love with Carla.
No, he's not.
Actually, I am.
You're starting again.
And Carla, you're mad that Turk didn't trust you enough to tell you.
See? Trust, woman, trust!
Whatever. The point is that Turk is sorry.
Not anymore!
I can't believe you thought he was a threat.
I'm a threat!
You're not in love with me, you idealize me.
Can we just try and stay focused
You're mad 'cause I'm scared of losing you?
Yes, because we're stronger than that!
Apparently not!
You should be glad I never took our relationship for granted, you silly woman!
If we could just refrain from name calling
Oprah's right!
Lay off of him.
You're just pissed because you're still in love with your ex.
Okay, that's it! Now, I have killed for so much less than that, and I'll damn-sure do it again unless you all shut the hell up right now and I MEAN NOW!
Aren't you glad we did this?
I'm going out for Mexican food tonight. And I'll see you in bed, my friend.
Oh, my God rounds!
The Hall
Rounds started five minutes ago, and I totally forgot about Mr. Zerbo! Oh, my God...Oh, my God...Oh, my God
Are you plannin' on makin' this worth my while?
Ow!
Dr. Dorian? How 'bout you step up to the mic and tell the entire gang how you ended up treating Mr. Zerbo.
Think, Whiz Kid, think!
Ah, the hell with it.
Sir, I did nothing.
Everyone in the ICU have halted their business to stare at J.D.
Is this because of the same kid as before?
Shh!
You did...nothing?
Nothing at all.
Great job, sport!
Huh?

column2: Dr. Kelso speaks to the other doctors

column3: Whenever a patient gets bounced from ward to ward, there's always a chance a high fever could be sustained or even caused by a constant stream of different antibiotics. It's call drug fever. And it's a good catch by Dr. Dorian.
Next patient! Mush, people.
Mush! Hyah! Hyah! Hyah!!!!
Thank you, doctor.
Oh, no problem.
It's funny.... I guess sometimes when you do nothing at all, things just have a way of fixing themselves.
The Hall
Hey.
The Cafeteria
J.D.'s Room Evening
Outside The Hospital The Wheelchair Ramp Day
Standing next to J.D. is the troubadour with his guitar.
...Day after day it reappears / Night after night my heartbeat shows the fear....
Ghosts appear and fade away / Come back another day
That'll do it.
I have other songs.
Yeah, ya do.

Do you know how I know that this is yours, Farrah? 'Cause when I paged you earlier, someone found it next to a can of Fresca and a dog-eared copy of Teen People magazine. Anyway long story, short: The whole incident gave me a bang-up idea; because, you see, I've got tomorrow off. So I'm gonna be on my couch, sipping on some scotch and paging you every twenty seconds. And if you don't answer every damn last one of 'em, I'm gonna shove this thing so far down your throat it's gonna make you take a tinkle every time it goes off. Big fun, right?
You're gonna need this.
Oh!
Oh!
Let it come. Let it Oh! Let it come!
Ahhh. It's good to be home....
...Sort of.
NEW_SCENE
Argh.

There. Just a tiny splinter! It's funny; I can't stop thinking about Aesop's Fables you know, the one where the the lion's always hassling the little mouse...but then the mouse pulls a thorn from his paw.
Oh, right.... But then the lion kills him anyway. Yeah.
No he doesn't.
Trust me.
Sandy, whatta ya say we start our work day.
You know, "Sandy" isn't necessarily a girls' name.
It's short for "Sandra".
Clear.
Hello, Perry.
Oh, God. The ex-wife.
Jordan. What a coincidence! You were in my dream last night. I can't say for certain, but I was having the flesh torn from my bones by a cross-eyed water snake you, right?
Yes.
Right?
Yeah.
Right?
Mm-hmm. Say, let's play a game: I'll throw out an adjective describing how one of you is in bed, and you guys try to guess who it is!
Remember, I had no idea she was your ex at the time.
Heh?
Okay. Clumsy!
Don't answer that, Newbie.
No worries.
Goodbye, Jordan. Sandy.
Ow!
Good job, D.J.
You know, it's J.D. Okay? And at least I remember the names of all my sexual partners.
Well, I'm sure that girl from high school and your bunk-mate from Camp Morning Wood are both extremely grateful. Yeah.
It was Camp Meadow Wood. ...I made a lanyard.
NEW_SCENE
It sounds insensitive, but hospitals can be kind of boring. So if a policeman gets into an accident with the bad guy he's chasing, well, it pumps ya up!
Okay, move it along, fellas, there's nothing to see here. I'll be over here.
Officer Berson was admitted with shortness of breath and chest pain.
Hey, J.D., do you think anyone else gets this excited over a car accident?
Maybe Hank....
We weren't the only ones psyched to be in the game.
The doctor is in. Bad guy, this is why you don't run from the po-lice! Baby, are you ready to rock?
Great. Another cocky resident that wants to start surgery before the attending shows up.
I'm sorry; I just figured that if we finished here quick enough, we might have enough time to pull the stick outta your ass. Whatta you say?
Perry.
Beelzebob. Lackey!
Hey, Dr. Cox.
I'm being honored tonight by the board of trustees, and they asked me to say a few words.
Oh! Yawn.
Anyway, I would like you to be the one who introduces me.
Wow. Seriously?
Yeah!
Not interested.
I didn't ask if you were interested.
Bob, I deeply dislike you. Honestly, it keeps me up at night.
Well, then, use that passion! Put that rage on the page!
Here's an idea: Why not use Big Chief Flop-Sweat, here?
Ted's not an impressive man.
Hey....! That Ah, he's right.
Okay.
NEW_SCENE
Officer Berson, you have a slight arrhythmia, so Dr. Dorian and I are going to monitor you very closely.
But don't worry, we're on top of it, okay?
There's nothing like that feeling of really taking charge of a situation.
Mary. Rhoda. Chart, please.
What'd I stutter? Gimme the chart. Atta girl. Ew. Man. I don't like his 0-2 set. Grab me a doughnut, will ya?
Oh, you mean like a um a blood-pressure thingie?
I mean like a glazed thingie. And I like sprinkles on half of it; so if you can't find a half sprinkled, get me all sprinkles and just go ahead and pick half of 'em off.
You know that was...kind of demeaning.

You know, you're right. Would you do me a favor and apologize to her while you get me some coffee. And please be quick, otherwise I'm just gonna have the manager send over a different waitress. Go. You're done now. Yeah.
The frustrating thing was, down in the OR, Turk was probably running the show.
Steady, Dr. Turk; only about two more hours.
Could you scratch my nose, please.
No. I can scratch _my_ nose. Oh, that feels good.
Yeah.
NEW_SCENE
Miss Sullivan, I just want to thank you and the rest of the board for giving me this award. The fact that your first choice passed away last weekend in no way makes it any less special.

Tell you what: Ten years form now, when I'm your boss, I'll go ahead and throw in a good word for you and you won't even have to ask....
I like to think that your life comes down to the choices you've made along the way.
Like standing up to a superior.
Or the choice to focus on what you have in common, instead of what you don't.

column2: Carla and Elliot are chatting away  enjoying their new hairstyles
column3: Carla's straight and sleek, Elliot's done in fat curls.
Or the choice to let someone help you, for once.
In the end, you just have to trust your decisions.
You're the husband? We've gotta get you some bigger hands.
And hopefully, you'll land on solid ground
Well what about your new mop?!
I like the old one.
But you cried!
No, that was you.
Glup.
That's a good one.
NEW_SCENE
Hospital Admissions

Mr. Hogan, I can't stress enough how much you gotta avoid the red meat. Cirrhosis of your liver is preventing it from filtering out all the toxins, and if those get to your brain you'd become encephalopathic leading to a mental status change.
So, what, I'm gonna start acting all crazy or something?
Well, you'll need a tin-foil hat to hold in all your thoughts.
But I can still have a tiny, little bite of my wife's carne asada, right?
Well....
The greatest thing about Carla is I always know I can count on her to be the bad cop.
Carla punches Mr. Hogan in the face.
What part of "no meat" don't you understand?
Well, I just thought that
Carla!
So if you don't listen to Dr. Dorian, you're gonna have to answer to me.
Okay! Ix-nay on the eat-may.
That's right.
We're a team.
What?
Eat-may sounds like "eat me."
Of course, on some teams, there's gonna be friction.
All right...we're done here. Bonnie, you close.
Damn!
Aw, don't be mad. Just be the good little beeyotch you are and wipe the sweat off my forehead.
Look, don't say "beeyotch", you can't pull it off which is interesting, being that you're the queen mother of all
Dr. Wen? My forehead's feeling a little misty.
Dr. Turk, are your hands broken?
No.
Here you go.
Mmm. That's nice...beeyotch.
And some teams, well, they never really seem to get together.
Dr. Cox! I'm so glad I caught you! I need
And there it is again that ringing in my ears. It's kind of an "Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!" but it's more piercing, more of an "Eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!"
She's trying to ask you a question.

Now you, you're more of a low-pitched "Ooga-ooga-ooga." It's more masculine, which, quite frankly, is surprising considering the source, but make no mistake oh, just equally annoying! Luckily, though, I know how to make the pain go away!
Ahhhh. Much better.
Can you believe that!? I mean, every time we even try to talk to him, he starts going off on one of these random tangents and....
Eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!
You know?
Clearly we're on the same page.
We're residents now, we should be treated more like colleagues, and I can't even get him to notice me.
Oh, God! Oh! Uh! Sorry, sorry, sorry!
Maybe if you wore your hair up?
NEW_SCENE
Admissions.
What's up?
Be careful here.... Don't give him anything.
Nothing. What. Is. Up. With. You...Man?
I always get this way in the fall, you know summer's gone, the days are shorter; it just makes me feel so...what's the word....
Sad?
Yes, that's it. I'm a janitor, so I couldn't think of the word "sad." I was gonna say, It makes me feel so "mop."
Let me explain, I
Go ahead, I'm "mopping."
Maybe I shouldn't bother.
Maybe you "mopn't."
I guess after a while, you just stop being surprised by people.
Yeah...I-I-I'm going to be needing a room.
Well, who can say no to 49-cent cheeseburgers?
Sure, but tack on the cost of medicine, your room, and pumping your stomach, and that 49-cent cheeseburger is gonna run you in the neighborhood of thirteen hundred dollars.
Heh. See, that's how they get you.
That's right.
Carla, your brother called.
Oh, cool.
I didn't know you had a brother.
That's my pet-name for Turk you know, 'cause he's mine and he's a black man: "My bruthah."
That is adorable. Do you think he'd mind if I call him that, too?
J.D., I was kidding.
I know. I'm still gonna ask. So, how come I don't know anything about your family?
I don't know. I g I'm just not big on sharing my personal life with people.
But you know everything about me. You even know I have them switch Lauren's shifts so we always end up working together.
NEW_SCENE
I didn't know that.
Well, you do now, because I'm _sharing_ with you.
Okay, I'm _leaving_ now.
Wow.
Another Friday night? That's three in a row!
I know, it's so unfair.
I'm mad about it.
NEW_SCENE
Bonnie is killing me; I'm telling you, I cannot beat this woman no matter what I try! She's like a ninja but worse!
Nothing's worse than a ninja they're masters of every style of combat.
Can we please talk about something other than Bonnie?
I think you should give Bonnie a break. You know, it's really hard being a woman around here...you can walk through walls and nobody notices you.
Not entirely unlike a...ninja!
Whatever. I'm out.
Catch you later, my bruthah!
I'll holla.
He said "Holla."
NEW_SCENE
Mr. Tillman's results are back. It's bad.
Dammit, Laverne. Why can't I ever be the one dying?
I don't know.
It...was...rhetorical. If you if you'd tell Mrs. Tillman that I'll be right out, that would be just...terrific.
Dr. Cox! Um, Mr. Tillman is my patient, too, you know.
He is?
Yeah, I was in the room with you this morning, remember?
Uhhh, no.
Well, I was. Anyway, um, I if you want, I could talk to his wife, because I...just really enjoy that kind of stuff.
Wait a minute: Are you actually saying you enjoy telling people their spouses are going to die?
....Yep! I mean, I know that that sounds a little bit weird, but I-I-I-I just really like being there for people; it's...kind of why I became a doctor in the first place.
Well, it's nice to know where the magic began!
There you go.
NEW_SCENE
So! How are my girls today? Fantastic. Listen

Dr. Kelso, if you're here to do one of your "How are my girls today, now let me tell you some things you don't want to hear" routines, I should warn you: I'm in a mood. So it's probably in your best interest to make up some lame excuse, turn around, and leave.
Young lady, I will not be spoken to like that! Luckily, for you, I have to go see Mrs. Pfitztuffulla down in Pfofferoptrics.
Atta boy.
Rough day, huh? Well, maybe it would help to share...with someone?
Okay. You want in? You want me to open up?
I think I can handle it.
Fine!
Carla's head opens up like the ark in 'Raiders of the Lost Ark'
I don't like the way I look. I don't like the way I think. I don't like the way I feel about how I look. ...I have too much hair, my boobs are too low, my butt is too big, and I'm so short!
Plus, when I work up this morning, I cried for like half an hour because I thought I was getting wrinkles, but it turns out I just fell asleep on Turk's corduroy pants!
Wow.
There. Now you think I'm the craziest woman here.
Dr. Cox let me tell a woman that her husband's dying!
No I don't.
NEW_SCENE
Huh! So I'm doing a Nissen gastric fundoplication; and you're doing...yet another appendectomy. How fun for you!
Please, you call that smack-talk? You shoulda asked me how it feels to be so far below you, I wouldn't be able to read "Suck it, Turk" if you wrote it on the bottom of your shoe.
Okay. How _does_ that feel?
Damn!

Doctors! Something I've taken great pride in over the years is Sacred Heart's involvement in the esteemed "Doctors Without Borders" program. Now, every year, I single out the most qualified surgical resident to accompany me to Mexico for a weekend. Anyway, I've made my decision....
Thank you, sir. You haven't lived until you've tasted El Todd's guac.
Dr. Turk, pack your bag.
Dang!
Blaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhahaha!
The O.R.
Shove it, Turk!
Oh, I'm gonna shove it. And love it. And dance around above it. Hey! Shove it, and love it, and dance around above it! Come on!
You see, that's what's really bothering me.
What, Turk and Bonnie? They hate each other.
Then why is he doing his "You're so getting a piece of this" dance?
He's not! That's his "In your face" dance.... Or it's his "There's a sale on lotion" dance. I dunno; he's got so many dances.
Please, they might as well be naked. Slut.
Carla! Trust me, there's no way that he's cheating on you.
Yeah, you're probably right.
Wait, that's it? You were just freakin' out.
Hey, you wanted in!
Crazy!
NEW_SCENE
Barbie....
Yessie?
How did it go with Mrs. Tillman?
It. Was. Awesome!
It's not possessed! It's...for sitting.
Excuse me?
For God's sake, you must park it.
'Course, what we generally do now is eat.
Eat.
I can't! I'm too nervous!
NEW_SCENE
Christopher!
Sorry, sir. I just can't believe Kelso chose me.
Yeah, me neither. I told him to take Bonnie.
So, then, why did he pick me?
Among all the surgery residents, what's the difference between you, Bonnie, Todd, Steve, Eric, and V.J.?
First of all, she's a
There it is.
Wait, because she's ?
Yep.
She?
Exactly.
Huh? It's because she's a woman.... Damn!
NEW_SCENE
Fork! Me can't eat soup!
Look, I don't think you're stupid, okay? Your job requires a lot of know-how. I mean, come on, it's not like you're ladling out sloppy joes or something.
You know, m-my uncle w-w-was a joer. Yeah...
Troy, let me fill you in on this guy.
J.D.!
Oh, thank God.
A lot happens in the cafeteria.... Whether you've just accidentally stolen your lunch....
Or you've finally gotten someone to notice you....
Or you've connected with a friend on a level you didn't know you could.
The cafeteria is just a happy place.
What's wrong with him?
The only reason why I'm going to Mexico is 'cause Bonnie's not a guy.
I'm sorry, Baby.
I can't believe you think I got a thing for her.
Oh, no.
Who told you that?
J.D. whirls around Turk, taping his entire face up to quiet him.
J.D. told you that!?
Mm-hmm.
Hey, when did you guys learn sign language!?
Night classes? Wait, when did _I_ learn sign language?
J.D. said you're a big ol' can o' crazy.
A little can...a very tiny, small can.
Nah; you said big can.
NEW_SCENE
Hall
Mr. Hogan, I've come up with a little mantra for you.
Hit me.
If meat is your treat, your esophageal varices will bleed into your intestines, causing you to digest your own blood, leading to a horrible, horrible death!
Catchy!
Just, uh, say it over and over again.
Horrible, horrible death. Horrible, horrible death. Horrible, horrible death....
Okay, you can fix this.
Carla, look, I messed up and I'm so sorry.
Bambi. We're good, okay? We're pals!
Ah, thank you!
So you think it's funny to switch people's shifts, huh?
Bye, pal!
I missed my baby's first steps!
I'm so sorry. Does this mean you're married?
NEW_SCENE
Dr. Kelso, can I bother you for a second?
Based on history, I'd say yes.
I know for a fact that Dr. Wen recommended Bonnie.

Dr. Turk, I chose you over that nice young lady because we're going to be moving around a lot, and I can't be pulling over every two minutes for pee-pee stops and those nylons that come in plastic eggs!
Dr. Kelso, don't you think that's a little sexist?

I don't know, sport? Is it sexist to hold the door for a woman? Is it sexist to keep the pretty nurses and unload a few uggos? The rules have changed so much, I just can't keep up. Tell you what: Let's stop jiggling each other's marbles _you_ decide who should go; that way, when you choose yourself, I won't have to deal with all this horrible guilt.
NEW_SCENE
Dr. Cox!
Aw, geez, Edith!
Hi!
This chair won't pull out.
Oh! Maybe that's because my ankles are wrapped around it. Lookit: I actually need some 'me' time.
Ohh.
Yeah.
Okay.
I just wanted to say that, if you have any other bad news situations, I would gladly handle them for you.
Really?
Gladly!
Well, welcome aboard.
Dude, why would you get turkey when there's egg salad?
Dude, there's no egg salad today.
Missed a spot. Mm-hmm.
NEW_SCENE
So, we're even, right?
Even. I told a nurse you switched her shifts you babbled all my crazy to the person I plan on spending the rest of my life with!
Well, I could've spent the rest of my life with Lauren! ...Or at least with her tushie. I just want to wash it is that weird?
You think this is funny?
Come on....
I told you how hard it is for me to let my guard down, and that quick, you burn me. Never again.
Well, don't walk away! Carla...come on.
NEW_SCENE

Bonnie. I found out that Dr. Wen actually recommended you for that trip to Mexico. I'm sure you know how hard it is for me to stand here and admit that to you, so I was hoping that we can use this as an opportunity to repair our relationship. What do you say?
Blaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!
Oh, my God. Okay, fine! Look, _you_ go to Mexico; okay? And, by the way, "dolor en el asno" means "pain in the ass" I thought it would help you when you introduce yourself.
I don't want your charity! You go. And every second you're down there, I want you to think about how I kick your ass up and down these halls all day long. Now...where was I?
Blah.
Oh, yeah!
NEW_SCENE
There ya go, prom queen. There's some really tragic stuff in there, so, you know, go nuts.
All all of these are your patients?
No, but when word got about your little offer, a bunch of other docs wanted in.
Oh, great! More for me!
I'm afraid you have hepatitis.
Meningitis?
Esophageal gastro duodenal colitis.
Yes, it's like being blind in one eye...except you'll be blind in both.
I'm really sorry, um...there's nothing more that we can do.
NEW_SCENE
Hello? We can hear you! Hello!?
Why won't it stop ringing!?!?
Hello??!!?? For the love of God! Hello???!!!
All right, look: Okay, I never meant to insinuate you guys were stupid, all right? Everyone knows you're a hundred times smarter than the jackasses that run this place.
Is that so, sport?
No, sir. It's not so. Ooh..
Would you just go ahead and answer it, already! Hello?
Hello.
Take that, smart guy!
Troy. That's not how we do it.
NEW_SCENE
Mr. Hogan, what the hell?
Well, what would you do if your five-year-old son begged you to have a bite of his dinner?
You had two dozen ribs!
I know.... I don't even have a kid.
That's it, I've I've had enough. This is ridiculous.
Will you lay off Mr. Hogan? So he made a mistake, all right, people make mistakes. When they do, it wouldn't hurt you to cut them some slack once in a while.
Thanks, man.
Quiet; this isn't about you! Don't eat meat!
Carla! Look, every time you screwed up with me, I've totally let you off the hook.
When have I ever screwed up with you?
Okay, never. But we both know that if you ever did, I would give you a break. Now let's see how you like it when I walk away from you.
Actually, I need to go this way.
Right the first time.
NEW_SCENE
Awesome!

Awww..... You're gonna love this one! Twenty-five-year-old woman dancer, actually...well, not anymore, I'm afraid we have to take both of her legs bilateral gangrene and seeing as her husband recently passed away, and her insurance at the dancer's union probably is not gonna cover it, you should go ahead and tell her she won't be able to stay here with us for her rehab.
Um, what...room is she in?

There is no room. In fact, in the history of medicine, there's never actually been a patient that depressing. I made it up! Come on, now, Barbie; you keep going down this road, you're gonna go up to the roof of this hospital and jump the hell off. Mind you, it's only five stories high, so that means you'll just wind up back down here, where I, of course, will be the one who has to treat you, and then I'll be forced to jump off the roof of this hospital, which, as I was suggesting to you, is only five stories high, and are you starting to see a pattern forming here?
I just wanted to be colleagues.

Barbie, as long as you stay and work at this hospital, I'm always gonna be your superior.... That's just the way it goes. Don't get me wrong, you can keep trying to connect with me; I mean, hell, you're...you're so damn entertaining you just might make some head-way. But still, you might be better served and, this is a crazy notion if you could stop worrying so much about who does and doesn't notice...you. Even for a second...that'd be good; that'd be real good.
I think every day is made up of tiny little tests.
Some are tests of character.
Some are tests of fortitude.
Others are tests of friendship.
I spoke to my brother today.
Really?
Mm-hmm. He's having some problems.
And if you're lucky, when it really matters, you'll pass with flying colors.
Hola, K-dog! Yeah-ha-ha! Full bar! Take us to Mexico!
NEW_SCENE
Hospital Admissions Area
Work seems different now that I'm a resident; I feel more confident, more like a hell, I'll say it a doctor.
Good morning, people!
You're gonna be fine, ma'am.
I work here.
That still doesn't change the fact that you're gonna be fine!
Why...in the hell are you wearing a coat?
'Cause I'm a doctor.
Look, Babs, if you're truly worried about people seeing your ass, just go ahead and do what all the other girls do and tie a sweater around your waist.
Well, I look doctorly!
No, you look like the guy who goes to a garage sale, buys a bronze star, pins it to his lapel, and then tells everybody to call him "Sarge." And Newbie, nobody likes that guy. Not a soul.
I was in the military.
Where did you come from!?
If I find out you're wearing a bronzie, without having served, I'm gonna make things uncomfortable for you.
Coat-wearing doctors do not take this crap.
You were never in the military.
Yes, I was.
Which branch?
The...janitor branch.
I'm watching you.
That's right, Sasquatch.
You see, things have changed.
We've begun to adapt to new situations.
Oh, my back is on fire. If Dr. Amato was any shorter, I'd be passing him instruments with my feet.
Dr. Turk, I need you down here.
Coming down.
NEW_SCENE
Even other people are starting to see us differently.
Hey there, Doctor.
Oh, me! Of course, because I'm a I'm a doctor. I mean I I've got the, uh, I've got the outfit. I've got the, uh, heart, uh, hearing thingie.
Uh, "stethoscope."
Oooh, paging Dr. Know It All to the cafeteria!
Ohhh, sweet baby James.
Most importantly, we've started to treat each other with respect.
Dude, you are such a loser, man.
I think I look spiffy. I'm trying to separate myself from the whole pack.
Oh, you already have, Bambi you're the biggest geek to ever come through here.
Yeah, he is.
Don't laugh you're the jocky frat-boy with a back problem.
Yeah, I am.
Oh, do me! Do me! Do me!
You're gonna want to be careful about yelling that out in a bar.
I'm serious! All you guys get to be something: The dork, the jock, the spicy firecracker from the school of hard knocks. No offense, Carla. Dammit, what am I?
You're white.
The whitest.
Yeah, you are.
Oh, come on, J.D.'s white!
I ain't hearin' that, woman, 'cause I'm talkin' to him.
Okay, it's a tie.
T. Diddy?
NEW_SCENE
You got me in the I.C.U. for a cold?

Mr. Blair, you have a severe sinus infection, with orbital extension; you were admitted delirious from your hundred-and-six degree temperature, completely naked and very adamant about staying that way.
I was hot.
I'll second that. Mm-hmmm....
Sharp coat, sport.
Oh, yeah. It's spiffy!
Shocker, Big Bob you care more about appearances than actual
Better finish that thought quickly, Perry, I'm not breaking my gait.
Just saying: Substance, style, what's important, coat, not
Ha! Ha! Ha! Too slow!
Think you really got through to him.
Oh, my God, you hear like a bat!
Idiot! I wish I had a guy in my life that would stop me before I did something stupid.
Fantasy Sequence: A Bar

column2: As he does this, he bellows an operatic
column3: MISTAKE!
I don't know why he's an opera singer.

Listen closely, Tiny Dancer: I wouldn't be flapping my mouth if I'd forgotten to get a blood culture on Mr. Blair. And, for the love of God, do you at least remember what you were doing the day they were passing out common sense? Oh, gosh, maybe you were running late that day 'cause you just couldn't find the right thong for those low-rider jeans that you love so much, or maybe you were busy bopping along to whatever boy band really makes your heart race nowadays, and you just drove on by. 'Course, I don't know, I'm just guessing, but one things' sure-shootin': you wound up at the dumb-dumb store and you just went ahead and put so much of that into the car that you could fit, didn't ya?
And then, I did something I've never done before....

Look, Doctor: If you flip the page on that chart, you'd see that I pan-cultured him yesterday; but that would probably get in the way of the perverse pleasure you take in pointing out other peoples' slip-ups. Well, too bad, Buster Brown! Because I'm a resident now, and I'm not gonna be making the same little silly intern mistakes I made last year. I'd appreciate it if you wouldn't stand here and yell at me in front of my patient.
Buster Brown.
Buster Brown.
Focus all energy on lip not quivering.
Wow!
NEW_SCENE
How's the back, Sweetness?
Perfect. Baby, I'm sorry the last couple of nights I haven't been able to give you the regular dose of the Turky jerky; but you rest assured your man will be back in action before you know it.
You go ahead and take your time.
Hey, there, big fella. Just checked the board we're together on a thyroidectomy
Oh, that's great, Dr. Amato.
Domo arigato, Dr. Amato.
How is that not funny?
I don't know, dude.
You know, you guys are getting to be like Starsky and Hutch.
That'd be true if Starsky was a ventriloquist and Hutch was a tiny puppet.
I would watch that show.
Yeah.
Why do you keep ending up with that guy?
Because the other surgeons are busting my chops for skipping guys' night out.
Oh, what, ending up with Dr. Amato is like a punishment or something?
No, dude; I actually enjoy needing you to lower me on the toilet in the morning.
Check that out.
I know it looks innocent, but Elliot was late this morning. Plus, once you've been here a while, you learn to read between the lines.
Fantasy Shot: Elliot strips off her top and jumps the doctor.
Mmm?
Mm-hmm.
NEW_SCENE
Well, Mrs. Bumbry, I wish I had better news, but, unfortunately, you didn't qualify for the G.I. clinical trial, so we'll just keep plugging away.
Great. So, how was the sex with that guy?
What guy? I was I wa I was I wasn't
Elliot. I have other patients, Mrs. Bumbry needs a nap, we're all very busy....
I have never done anything like this; I just met him and slept with him! POW!
God, I miss one-night stands.
The best thing was, since I knew it was just a fling, I wasn't afraid to ask him for exactly what I wanted.
Which was?
Shirt on, lights off, no talking.
Well, you just be careful you wouldn't believe how quickly a reputation can be made in this hospital.
You're a bit of a slut, aren't you!
As soon as we get out of this sterile field, I am going need the man who hit that to hit that!
Admissions
Wait a minute. _I'm_ Elliot Reid. People! Listen up! This rumor ends right now!
She slept with him, and she hardly knew him.
Does that happen a lot around here?
Not enough.
Mr. Blair, that infection keeps hanging around so I wanna put you on a broader spectrum antibiotic that we'll administer intravenously.
But I'm feeling a lot better.

I'm gonna tell you something my mom used to tell me whenever I was scared: In the case of severe sinus infection not responding to a three-day cycle of antibiotics, the recommended protocol is Imipenem, 500 milligrams, I.V.q. six hours. Got me through a lot of hard times.
I love it that Mr. Blair trusted me. It's one of the best feelings you can have as a doctor.
How's it goin'?
You can't wear that!
What, you mean after Labor Day? Eh.
You know what I mean!
It's a white coat. Anybody can wear a white coat.
Jerk!
You're what we call a "goner." I'm kidding there's nothing here.
NEW_SCENE
So, Mrs. Bumbry, here, has inflammatory bowel disease, huh?
Yeah; and the new drug they're testing at the clinical trial could really help her out but, of course, she doesn't qualify.
Right.
You okay, Mrs. Bumbry?
I liked Bow Wow when he was Lil' Bow Wow.
Oh, she's right rappers, they grow up so fast.
Look, Carla, if you're gonna survive in medicine, you've got to accept the fact that rules are rules. Hey! Anyone from that clinical trial around? Hello? Hello?
Yeah, this lady's supposed to be in this trial.
Okay.
What the hell did you just do?
When you speak of this and I know you will could I be shirtless? See, I think it would be more impressive if I was shirtless.
NEW_SCENE

Look, all I'm saying is, if you are a criminal, even if you aren't afraid of Starsky, if you round a corner and a tiny little Hutch puppet jumps out at your face "Freeze, sucka!" you're done for, it's over.
Does it have a real gun or a puppet gun?
Puppet gun. They'd sew it to its hand.
Okay, I'd watch that.
What's up, fellas!
I don't care what hospital you go to, Surgery is still a boys' club.
I'm just as cool as those guys.
Bye, Turk!!!

T-Dog, settle a little medical debate for us: I think Elliot's got a modest rack, at best; but my favorite attending, here, says that when he was "tuning in Tokyo" the other night, the reception was excellent!
You guys, Elliot's a friend of mine, so I really don't want to talk about that, okay?
So, Dr. Turk, how is your back?
My back's as swollen as Elliot's big-ass breasts, sir.
NEW_SCENE
I was paged?
The patient's complaining of anosmia.
Anosmia? You know, I always thought it was very funny that losing your sense of smell was called "anosmia." "A-_nos_-mia", you know, like "_schnoz_mia." Don't you find that very funny?
He doesn't.
I'm calling Dr. Cox.
Whoa; nobody needs to go call Dr. Cox.
This is only temporary, right?
'Course it's temporary. It could also be slightly more un-temporary.
You mean "permanent."
Just when you think you have this place figured out, it finds a new way to get you.
I'm waiting.
Unfortunately, you've, uh, put us in somewhat of a legal bind.
Way to go, Ted. My God, man, you couldn't scare a child.
Who who would want to?
Dr. Cox, do you have any idea how much money this hospital makes from that G.I. trial into which you took the liberty of enrolling your patient?
I'm gonna go ahead and guess: Seven dollars.
Sometimes it comes right at you.
Keep smiling, tough guy. First I'm going to report you to the Ethics
Better finish that thought there, Bobcat, 'cause I'm not breaking my gait.
What are you looking at?
Nothing.
Sometimes it sneaks up on you.

Plus, when she dated J.D., she would just wear a t-shirt in the morning; so when she reached up high to grab a box of cereal, everybody in the room got two scoops of booty-flakes; and the two scoops they were packed with flavor. You know what I'm sayin'! Right? Right? Right!
