There's a lot of chaos and screaming, and...you know...eventually you get your glasses snapped in half by the big kid who already has underarm hair. But then you wake up in the hot nurse's office, and when she leans in to put that bandage on your nose, you get a sense that something could actually happen if you just took a chance and buried your face in her knockers.
Holy cow. I'm so sorry. I guess, for my part, I think death is a lot like that story, quite frankly. But, if there is a God, it'll be a lot quicker and half as painful.
It's fun to annoy him!
It's what I do.
NEW_SCENE
So, I hear they're making that office into the ladies' locker room, huh?
Yes, Ted.
Bummer!
We hey, maybe whoever's over here might not stay there forever!
Well, I'm here doing a research fellowship, so I'll be anywhere from fifteen to twenty-five years!
That's a long time.
Yeah!
You'll probably be dead!
NEW_SCENE
So, um, we've known each other for, like, a year and a half, right?
Turk. That's my ride.
Yeah, I know, just give me a second. Just give me a second, okay? I've been thinking a lot lately.
I'm talkin' here!
Turk, I'm I'm gonna miss my flight. I gotta go, Honey, I'm sorry.
Will you marry me?
What did you say?
I think I said, Will you marry me?
Turk, wow!
I got a ring. Um.... I don't have it on me, but, uh...it's in a safe place.
I can't believe this! I I've imagined you saying this to me like a thousand times.... I just never imagined that when you actually asked, all I would say is...I need to think.
Cool! Uh.... Yeah, whew! That's that's that's that's what I was hoping to hear!
I love you. I really do.
Love you, too.
I'll be back in a few days.
I'll wait.
NEW_SCENE
Congratulations, you guys. He's doing great.
I guess sometimes my whole theory about life and death balancing each other out in the hospital doesn't hold true. I guess sometimes you get lucky.
What's going on?
She's coding!
NEW_SCENE
The lights in the room go down and Elaine, dressed in a lovely scarlet gown, stands next to her bed, bathed in the glow of a theatrical spotlight.
Any minute now, my ship is coming in / I'll keep checking the horizon / I'll stand on the bow, feel the waves come crash in.
Come crashing down, down, down / On me.
And you say, 'Be still, my love'
Open up your heart, let the light shine in.
Don't you understand, I already have a plan / I'm waiting for my real life to begin.
My real life to begin
Oh, oh, oh, don't you understand
I already have a plan.
I'm waiting for my real life to begin.
On a clear day, I can see.....
See a very long way.
She's gone. You gonna be okay?
....Yeah.
NEW_SCENE
It's not every day your best bud asks his girlfriend to marry him.
Hey, Chocolate Bear! Did you ask her?
She said she needed to think about it, then she hopped on a plane to Chicago for five days.
He needs you. Stay positive.
Woo-hooooo! She's thinkin', she's thinkin', and we should go out drinkin'! chicka uh-huh chicka-chicka.... Wanna get a beer?
I'm not leaving this spot until she calls.
All right, man. I understand.
Still nothing?!
We just keep missing each other. I'm not sweating it.
She asked me to pick her up from the airport! That's a good sign, right!
Good sign? Dude, I am so sure Carla's gonna say yes, if she doesn't I'll power-walk naked through these halls singing "Me and Bobby McGee"!
Ahhh, Janis Joplin! My God, she was an uggo! No offense, sport uh, don't think I have anything against ugly people.
Why would I take offense to that?
No reason. Anyway, I see you're on the nephrology service for Dr. Townshend this month!
Dr. Townshend is like the Anti-Kelso.
Hey, Doc!
The nurses love him...
Betty! That color is great on you!
The attendings love him....
Hey! How's the best doctor in this hospital?
You tell me, hot-shot!
Everyone loves him.
...Hello, my honey / Hello, my rag-time, summer-time gal!
Send me a kiss by wire!
Ooooooh / By wire!
Yes, sir!
Baby, my heart's on fire...on fire....
Everyone.
Thank you. For being you.
And the weirdest thing of all is that he and Dr. Kelso are best friends.
There he is!
Missed you on our morning jog, Bobby. What is that now, about two hundred days in a row?
You're a pistol!
The only place this guy's running to is to a bakery! Who's got me up high?
Ehhh.
Uh, mistake you made there, J.D.: You didn't pat his belly it soothes him.
Ahhh. Dammit.
NEW_SCENE
It's so beautiful.
Yeah, well, you know, I woulda showed it to you before you left, but, uh...I couldn't get to it. And that is a long story.

I want to thank you for not pressuring me. I mean, don't get me wrong, you left me like forty messages in five days; but...I know you if you weren't holding back, it woulda been like a hundred and forty.
I do love the speed dial!
So, you got an answer yet?
What's the deal, there, Gandhi? Are you gonna be a bride?
Ohhhh, come on. This is one of those very small windows when I'm borderline interested in your life. So, what's the deal? Did she give you an answer?
Not yet.
Thanks, Todd. Here's that fifty bucks I promised you.
Keep it, man. That was for me!
Todd, get dressed.
I'm going back out there!
NEW_SCENE
I still can't believe I power-walked 'butt-naked' through the halls of the hospital last night.
My man, I know that wasn't you.
How?
I'm not really proud of this, but I can pick your puff-'n'-stuff out of a line-up.
Oh, it changed since you saw it it got a haircut.
Yeah.
Turk's brother is staying with us for the weekend.
Hey, hey, hey!
Little brother!
It'll be fun.
Hey, Kev'!
Hey, Alfalfa! What's the happie-haps?
Oh, that depends.... What's a "happie-hap"?
So, this is the place, huh? This is nice! Hey, hey, so, uh, how is this baby? Is it all right?
This, right here, is fit for a king.
Well, that's good. That makes me feel better about sleeping in your room while you're comfy out here.
No, Kevin, that's not gonna work.

Well, I'm a business man we can work something out. Let me see, I sent you to college, and med school, and you have done nothing for me; so, I tell you what: I'll sleep on the couch, and you cut me a check for eighty grand.
I'll go get my pillow.
Yeah.
That was good, Kevin! We should we should make him, like, make dinner for us tonight. He could be our own personal slave!
Our own personal _what_, now?
Oh, no, I don I don't mean like _that_ kind of slave.
Well, how 'bout this: How 'bout he be the house slave, and I be the field slave. That sound like fun to you?
That that wouldn't be fun....
What's going on?
I forgot how much fun it was messing with Alfalfa!
NEW_SCENE
No, honey, the reason we're late is that you took forever to get ready. That's what happens when you're vain!
Whatever you say, Mr. Yesterday I Had Chest-hair, Today I Suddenly Don't.
Sometimes Elliot just can't help herself.
Dr. Cox! You're a waxer?
Hark, it is the high-pitched warble of the nosy nelly! Don't see many of those flitting about these halls anymore because, well, quite frankly, when one does one shoots to kill.

Now, Bar-bie, Jordan is here for her ultrasound today, and I'm going to be holding her claw the entire time. So, what you've just done is essentially volunteered to do all of your work and all of mine. And if you'll step right this way, I'll be more than glad to tell you more about what you've won!
See you at lunch, Bobby?
Split-pea soup today!
Oh!
You know, sir, Dr. Townshend, here, was telling me you have some great old stories about the hospital. I...I'd love to hear one sometime.
Well, what the hell. Back in '68...I don't like you. The end.
He tells that one a lot.
I know.
NEW_SCENE
Look, I know you're laboring over this whole proposal thing, so I thought I'd sweeten the pot by letting you know I have a killer best man's toast.
Oh, yeah, yeah, yeah. I'm gonna rush the biggest decision of my life so I can hear you say, "When I first met Chris Turk, I knew this was a guy I could party with forever! Yeah!"
Please!
She's psychic!
I just wanna have a nice lunch with my boyfriend and his brother, okay?
What Carla didn't know was that Turk was using his brother as a selling point. Because no one said "family" more than Kevin Turk.
Baby.
Yeah?
Check out my bother's kids.
Awwwwww.... They're adorable!
How's that great marriage of yours, man?
Over.
Oh, no.
Say what?
I couldn't take it anymore. I had to get the hell out of there!
Get the hell out of there?
Oh, my God! Do something to change the subject! Anything!
Everybody! Soda chugging contest!
Mmph.
'Scuse me.
When did you have the fajitas?
NEW_SCENE
So...are we finding out the sex of the baby today?
Yes we are.
No, we're not.
Jordan, be reasonable. If you're incubating some kind of man-bat in there, we should find out about it as soon as possible there are vaccinations to consider.
Tell you what, we'll compromise. I'll decide this, and you get to decide...um.... Sorry, I got nothing.
Look, it's common for each parent to feel differently.
Actually, I am not the father; he's a bell-boy in Greece.
We think.
Neat.
It's kicking me.
Who could blame the poor thing.
NEW_SCENE
Huh. That's odd.
What the hell just happened?
I moved your ladder.
I don't know...why you keep doing these things to me!
I don't know, either!
Well, if it isn't my favorite custodial engineer! Listen, do me a favor, will you?
Yeah?
Help me look after this kid one of the good guys.
So, look, Chris, I got a meeting this afternoon...but what do you say tonight, me and you tear it up like we used to!
I gotta work.
Well, get somebody to cover for your ass, man! I'm only here for the weekend!
Look, I _just_ asked Carla to marry me, and you were in there acting like a jerk.
Oh, man! You you you're engaged!? Congratulations!
She hasn't exactly said yes yet.
Well, that that that that's all right. Sometimes a lady just needs to sleep on it.
I asked her a week ago.
Damn!
Yeah.
Well, on the bright side, you are definitely flying solo tonight, huh!
I'm out.
Hey, Chris, come on now I was just playing.
CHRIS!
NEW_SCENE
If you really don't want to know the sex, it's time to look away.
Dr. Cox, I excuse me um, I just need you
Ah-ba-ba-ba.
You know, Jordan, this is ridiculous; I'm gonna find out the sex of the baby
Yeah, Dr. Gerson's not gonna tell you.
Oh, look!
Oh, gosh...I guess I'm stuck, then. All righty.
We'll talk later.
Go!
Out! Chop-chop! Whoa!
NEW_SCENE
Sir, can I call you "Townsie"?
No.
I was having a great time working with Townsie.
Now, Mr. Singer, here, needs a swan. So, why don't you go ahead and do an IJ cut down?
A _cut down_? No one does those anymore.
Uh, sir, shouldn't I just do a modified Seldinger? I mean, it's so much safer.
Nah, come on, let's do "old school."
But, sir, I don't
Grab a scalpel; I'll get the kit.
Somebody?
So often in a hospital, you feel like you're alone on an island. Whether it's because you just can't bring yourself to make a really important decision...
Carla looking at her ring.
Or because you're waiting for an answer...
Turk lost in thought.
Or simply because you know a secret you wish you didn't.
Elliot nervously passing a hopeful Cox.
For me, I was stuck on that island because somebody else put me there.
Okay, come on now, just cut through.... Good. Now, open up the vein.... But be careful not to nick the carotid artery.
Oh, boy.
Oh, no.
NEW_SCENE

The vascular surgeon on call said to say you could pick up your patient this evening. He also said to say he could give you a loaner patient if you needed someone to butcher until then.... But I didn't really get it.
No one expects you to, son.
Okay, thanks.
All right, this sucks. But, as bad as I feel, I'm sure Dr. Townshend feels even worse for making me do the procedure.
Don't worry about it I'll take the blame, okay?
He hides it well.
NEW_SCENE
Do you really think he wants to get married?
Listen, any guy who'd be willing to scour the face of the earth to find the world's smallest diamond ring clearly knows just exactly what he wants.
I just don't know if he's mature enough. I mean, he couldn't stop giggling when he found out he had to operate on Mr. Wiener.
It's a funny name!
Stop it.

Look: The guy's twenty-seven years old, he's a surgeon currently involved in a long-term monogamous relationship; and as much as I'd love to trash him, I'm afraid I'm not down with the whole maturity thing.
Barbie!
Barbie, lookit, I need you to go down to the lab and get Mrs. Miller's blood-work; I also need you to disimpact Mr. Burnett in 317; and what did you say the sex of the child was?
I've got a better idea: You do those things, and when you're done, I'll think about telling you the sex.
Huh, that's weird. It seems like you just went to a swap meet and got yourself a big-boy spine. Now, listen, you tell or else!

Or else what? You'll treat me worse than you usually do? Here's the inside scoop, Perry: For the first time, I have leverage. You're familiar with leverage, right? It's what you're going to need when you disimpact Mr. Burnett who, by the way, is so locked up, I'm guessing he's been eating either gum, rubber cement, or cork.
Look. Barbie.
Yeah...that's not my name.
Fine.... Dr......Reid? Really?
What?
Nothing.
Elliot Reid in the house!
NEW_SCENE
Sit.
Oh, no thanks... I'll just go
I'm not asking.
All right, guys, this is the kid I was telling you about we're gonna look out for.

This is Brent from Parking. He's gonna set you up with a sweet spot right at the main entrance so you'll never be late again. This is Crazy-Eyes Margot, from Housekeeping. She's gonna make sure that you got freshly-pressed scrubs in your locker every morning. 'Course, this is Troy, you know him from the cafeteria line. He's gonna stop spitting in your food.
Thank you...for that.
I still don't understand...why we got to be nice to this pal.
'Cause I said so.
Yeah, but!
Troy! No more warnings.
Whoa! Bring the hands in.

Bless us, O Lord, in these thy gifts which we are about to receive from thy bounty. Through Christ our Lord, Amen. Look out for each and every one of us, including our new member. Also...help Margot to find her way home tonight.
Still...something was bothering me.
Bob, come on, how many more times are you gonna make me apologize for introducing you to your wife?
Once a month, until she's dead!
Excuse me, sir, do you have a second?
Sport, what did I tell you about my open-door policy? I don't have one.
Dr. Kelso, I was the one who nicked the artery on Mr. Singer.
Oh, cheese on rice, son! I just said it was me!
You need to shape up, son. Lord knows you're never gonna get by on your looks.

All right, first of all, at the very least I'm interesting looking; all right? And secondly, I...feel I made that mistake because Dr. Townshend forced me to perform a procedure that is unsafe and...outdated.
Sorry, Townsie.
Now, let me get this straight: You screwed up doing something you should've been able to handle, and now you're in here to tattle on the very guy who's taken the bullet for you. Is that right?
Do me a favor, will ya, son? Grab that for me?
Thanks!
I'm sorry, sir.
NEW_SCENE
Kelly clamp.
One Kelly clamp coming right up.
Hey, Rowdy!
You seem distracted. Is something wrong?
No, sir. I call everyone..."Rowdy."
What did you want me to do? Leave him in the car?
It's bad enough you freaked out my girlfriend, but now you wanna get me fired! Why don't you just smack me in my face?
Fine. Hey, check this out!
I can't believe that you're giving me attitude. I've taken care of you your entire life, and I come here and I tell you that I'm getting divorced, and you make it all about you!
Well, you didn't seem too broken up about it, Kevin! Why should I care?
She left me, okay?
NEW_SCENE

All righty, there, Dr. Leverage. Listen up, because here's the real 'inside scoop': I could literally sculpt a gigantic Mr. Burnett out of what I just removed _from_ Mr. Burnett. So, I really think it's in your best interest for you to start talking. Should I get the child a baseball glove or a tutu?
Well, girls can play baseball, too!
Oh, yak-yak-yak-yak I know what girls can do! You've come a long way, baby. Spill, doll.
Look, I really think that you should think about this. So, I wrote it down, and I put it in an envelope, and then I gave it to...her.
Hi, Honey.
Oh, you are just so gonna pay for this.
Yeah...well, uh, so are you.
Bend over, baby.
Oh!
NEW_SCENE
I think Mr. Singer's going to be just fine.
Oh, geez, Bob! Don't creep up on me like that! I almost dropped some fruit in my loops!
I'm sorry, buddy. Say, listen, uh...nowadays it has become kind of hospital protocol to do modified Seldinger in a case like this. You _do_ know how to do one of those, don't you?
'Course!
Good. Because the patient in bed number 2 needs one. You mind doing it for me?
What the hell's this all about?

Nothing! I was, uh, just looking over your files and, um...well...your osteoporotic patients aren't on Bisphosphonate; your diabetics aren't on ACE inhibitors. Doug, a lot of your treatments are pretty out of date.
Come on, Bob, I'm guys like us, we're set in our ways.

Well, this is not an age thing, Doug. Hell, these days if you've been out of med school five years, half of what you learned is obsolete. Why do you think I spend every other weekend at a seminar in some two-star hotel ballroom that still stinks of last night's prom vomit? I do it because I have to keep up.
Also, it gives you two days away from the missus, right? Once again, I am sorry I was the one who introduced you in the first place!
Look, Bob, I just...I don't have the energy for all that stuff.
Well...then we got a problem.
NEW_SCENE
So, you wanna talk about what happened?
Nah, man, look, it's it's just too depressing.
Kevin, you're in a bad place right now, but you're gonna get through it. You just gotta give it time.
Yeah, well what am I supposed to do until then?
Barkeep, I'm gonna need these two glasses, and that bottle of whisky.
'Scuse me, yes, my brother definitely needs to borrow your hat. And for the love of all that is holy! Will somebody please put on some country!
NEW_SCENE
We are a horrible couple.
You couldn't be more wrong. Because, even though that isn't my kid in there, I still want to feel connected. And I just thought I'd be more hooked in if I knew.
It's funny. Every time I think you're the same old sharp-edged jack-ass, you turn around and do something to remind me that you're such a pansy.
Ahh.
Listen, I was really hoping that the two of us could find out when the baby comes. But, if you really need to know now, just keep it to yourself.
Yeah, run away, there, missy. 'Cause guilt trips don't work on ol' Perr-a-reeno. Ah?
Sport, if you're still standing there when I turn around, I'm gonna have them erase your name, too.
Goodnight, sir.
It's not always easy to do the right thing.
This is to my brother, y'all! My brother!
Like putting someone else's feelings first for a change.
Even if it goes against what you really want.
I'm out.
Of course, there's always ramifications....
My car....
Yeeeeeeee-ha!
You think it's my fault he got fired, don't you.
Why would you say that?
No reason.
Let's see ya drive home now, Mr. Doctor-Man!
Troy. I said just stand there, didn't I.
Yeah....
I may have to get rid of the guy.
Even if you do the right thing, there's no guarantee it'll turn out the right way.
He ain't heavy...he's my brother....
the brother!
Oh, oh. She, uh, she's not with him. And she ain't with me. She's, uh, shes with Rowdy not like not like that.
Because, even something as harmless as twenty or thirty drinks with your brother can end up biting you on the ass.
NEW_SCENE
Turk's relationship is so messed up right now that I decided to lighten his mood. And nothing cracks him up more than the old block-the-door-with-my-foot gag.
Ooh! Ow! Oh, oh, okay.
Oops. Wrong person.
What happened?
A card musta got stuck. Gotta go!
Baby, you know how much I care about you, right?
I'm dizzy.

Yeah, you're fine. Honey, I know it looked really bad last night, with me and Kevin coming home all liquored up with a really hot chick, but Kevin was freaking out about his divorce and I was just trying to be supportive.
Yeah, by dragging home some random bar skank.
Yeah, dude, you're not helping.
Not trying to help.
The point is, I have figured out why you're not ready to marry me yet. You think I'm too immature.
It's not about that.
Is it my sleep toots? 'Cause, Baby, I will stop having dairy after six.
I don't know what it is, Turk. Since the moment you asked me, all I wanted to do was say yes. It's just that, every time I try to, something stops me. You just...have to be patient.
Yeah, about that....
So, he just said he was gonna keep asking until I said yes.
That was exactly how I lost my virginity. Except, I'm guessing Turk didn't propose in Jim Vilicetti's crawl-space.
Yes?
Woo-hoo! You said yes! We're getting married! We're getting married!
Turk. Stop celebrating that's just how I answer the phone. ... Honey, it's only been ten minutes since we last talked....
Don't you hate it when people yap away on their cell phones.
She is my friend.
...But she is _so_ rude.
Hey, don't you work at the hospital, too?
Yeah. Um...I actually just got off a double shift, that's...why I look so gross.

You don't look gross. And you know what? You don't even _think_ you look gross. I'm guessing you're one of those girls who uses the self-deprecating thing as a defense mechanism; even though, without looking, you can tell right now how many guys are checking you out.
Okay, five.
No, no. Actually, it's four the guy in the mullet, he's checking me out.
I let him buy my last two drinks.
Thanks again, cowboy!
NEW_SCENE
So, what, you're just gonna keep on asking her?
If you love somebody, you gotta be willing to break their spirit.
Here you go, fellas.
Thank you, Jenny.
Yoooooooo! Check out these fries! That girl is so in to me.
Please, she's totally crushing on the brother.
Why, because you're black?
'Kay, let's get one thing straight: This has nothing to do with me being black this has something to do with me being smooth, dawg
Oh. Here's a towel.
And here are your shakes.
Thank you, Jenny. Hey, wait, Jenny. Uh, what flavor do you usually go for: Do you like chocolate or _vanilla_?
I'm a vanilla girl.
Mmm?
I'll go get you some more towels.
Go ahead and say it.
She got Jungle Fever! She got Jungle Fever!
NEW_SCENE
I had so much fun tonight. I hope I didn't talk about myself too much.
Hey, Elliot, I said I wanted to know everything about you; and...now I do.
So, listen, I'd like to take you out tomorrow night. I don't want to seem like I'm rushing things, but
See you tomorrow.
Oh my God!
What?
I'm just not big on public displays of affection, that's all.
Hit it!
Woo-hoo!
Carla Espinosa! Will you marry me?
Oh, my God....
Come on, citizens! Let me hear ya! Honk in the name of love!
Honk for love! Honk for love!

column2: Amid the cacophony of honking, Elliot smiles at the display, but Carla's face shows an internal struggle
column3: Die on the spot to save herself the embarrassment, or kill Turk? Decisions, decisions....
NEW_SCENE

I've gotta say, life is pretty good. I've hit my stride as a doctor, all my patients are doing well, and I've finally figured out that, even though they're horribly uncomfortable, my medium scrubs have a large effect on the ladies.
Yep, everything is just great. I feel like, for the first time since I started here, I have no stories to tell.
Sometimes you know it's gonna be a crappy day from the moment you wake up. Today was one of those days.
See, I have an appointment to see my shrink, and it feels like there's a little friction between us.
You will _not_ beat me.
Listen, Doctor, while we're on me, just for a second, uh, my very pregnant ex-wife would like me to take a couple of days off and travel to her mother's house so that we can reconnect as a family.
And I assume that you told her to blow it out her ass.
You get me! Darn it, you do!
Yes.... We're like two peas in a horrible, horrible pod.
Anyway, I have invited a couple of my friends over to the apartment while she's gonna to be gone we're gonna have some beers, watch the game, it's gonna be great and I was wondering if you
I'm not your friend!
They're not, either.
So, how's your rage going lately?
The Hospital
Aggggghhhhhhh! Agggggggggghhhhhhhhhhhh! Aggggggggggggggggghhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!
Better!
Okay, the next time you feel the anger welling up in your meaty chest
Oh, give it to me.
...I want you to take a deep breath and count to ten before you react. Do you think you could do that, Perry?
For the record, I'm not a child. Okay?
Uh, Dr. Cox?
Um...I just wanted to tell you, uh.... W-w-what the thing is is, uh....
One....Two....Ten.
Um
Finish the sentence in the next two seconds or start running.

Oh, dear God, you're actually frozen with fear. All right, don't worry about a thing, I'm going to talk you through this. I want you to relax, take a big breath, and now... get out of here!! You go-go-go-go-go-go-go-go!
Morning, Dr. Cox!
Gladys! Ginger! Tiffany! No, Cheryl! Betsy...Betsy! Mm! That's new!
Betsy, good morning. Let's make with the chop-chop.
You know, you already used Betsy, like, six months ago.
I don't care!
Dammit!
Perry! Hi, how are you, etcetera. The wife and I just took out a new insurance policy, and I need a physical.

Bob, the day I willingly cradle your dusty old twig and berries and get a whiff of your chronic halitosis while you turn your head and cough is the day you can look for me up on the roof singing, "I Believe I Can Fly."
Great stuff! See you about two-ish.
Uh.
You should just do it.
Really?
Well, it'd only take fifteen minutes of your life, and it wouldn't hurt to be in good with him for once.
You're giving me advice?
Yeah. Feel free to return the favor.
Fair enough. Try this on for size: No matter where you go in life, always keep an eye out for Johnny, the tackling Alzheimer's patient.
What's that supposed to mean?
NEW_SCENE
Mm-hmm. Well, just run one of the other nurses down here with some bedpans, please.
Laverne, why can't you do it?
'Cause I've been here for twenty-three years and my feet hurt, that's why.
Well, thanks a lot! After all I've done for you....
Oh, Laverne, I am so excited about this doctor that I just met. He's nice...and humble.... I just hate it how so many doctors are so self-centered, you know?
Mm. I know exactly what you mean, girl. Just yesterday, I was
Oh, and he's so cute, too!
Hey, fresh bedpans, here. Get 'em before they're hot.
Dr. Reid!
Hey! Uh, Nurse...um...Paul.
It's Paul Flowers, actually.
Flowers?
Yep. Up you go.
NEW_SCENE
Marry me.
Still thinking.
Okay. Baby, I have finally figured out what's bothering you, though.
Really?
Yep. You think I haven't played the field enough.
Well, I just want you to know that I have had a long, productive playing career, over which time I have slept with many, many women....
And by "many, many women" I mean...three.
Mmmmmm.
Take away two, equals one, and that's you. Marry me?
No.
NEW_SCENE
All right, so here's the deal: I want to see all you guys at my place tonight even you, Zeltzer. Get there around 7:30, it's gonna be great; we're gonna have food, booze, the whole nine yards.
Uh, will there be prostitutes?
Noo!
Oh, uh, good.
NEW_SCENE
It's just a physical. You can be cordial.
Whatta ya say, there, Bob. How 'bout we do just like you do with Enid close our eyes, pretend we're with someone else, and be done before Leno starts.
Save the 'racket' for the tennis court, big guy. I have taken the liberty of filling out the form, all you have to do is sign right below where it says "Fit as a 26-year-old."
You're not suggesting that I rubber-stamp your insurance physical, are you, there, Bobbo?
Just...sign the damn form!
Or...you could take your shirt off right now and be done with all this in the next five minutes. I am not going to make this uncomfortable for you, come on, I'm a professional.
Okay.
Buh-duh-na-duhhh...ooh!...ba-duh-duh-duhhh....da-bow!
Had to be done, Bob. Continue, handsome.
How's it going?
I just got my vertebrae fused.
I got nothing.
Hey! Hold that elevator!
I'm pressing the button.... It's not working.
NEW_SCENE
Hold it! Hey! Hold it!
Morning, ma'am.
I can't move my head.
So what?
Carol, I cannot thank you enough. Mmm...is that Ben-Gay?
NEW_SCENE
Come on, Elliot. So, Paul's a male nurse. You're a big enough person not to let that bother you, right?
I'm dating a _murse_.
Better than a 'mecretary.' Or a 'manicurist.' No, that works.
It's no big deal you guys are the only ones who know.... And Nurse Roberts.
She's not _that_ much of a gossip. Is she?
Nurse Roberts is running through at top speed, passing on some very important information to everyone she sees.
Dr. Reid, Nurse Paul! Dr. Reid, Nurse Paul! Dr. Reid, Nurse Paul! Dr. Reid, Nurse Paul!!! Dr. Reid, Nurse Paul! Dr. Reid, Nurse Paul! Dr. Reid, Nurse Paul!
Ohhh, talking about thirty-six inches, and about 70 pounds. Plus he's twice as fast as the other guy.
Dr. Reid...Nurse Paul...dating.
Giant "Who cares?"
So, I'll see you fellas tonight, what, around 7:30? Don't be late, or you won't get a seat!
I'll bring the Fluffer Nutters!
Newbie, I'd invite you, unfortunately it's guys only.

You! And your damn physical! Thanks to the high blood pressure you found, my insurance premium is gonna cost me an extra six grand this year! That's six grand my wife already spent on a new chin! If I were you, I would be planning to work every holiday from now until a few months after you're dead!
Newbie, this is your fault!
Where is he? Where is that little rat bastard?
Ohh. Hey, pal!
I'll always remember our time together. Gotta go!
NEW_SCENE
Marry me.
Still thinking.
Baby, I figured it out. This is what you're afraid of: The typical surgeon a dumb, arrogant frat-boy whose behavior is so disgusting, it is embarrassing for a woman to be _seen_ with him.
Mm.
No offense, buddy.
None taken. Hey, I gotta run. They're doing a breast reduction on three, and I want to get up there and try and stop it! You know what I'm talking about!
It's not The Todd.
It's gotta be The Todd.
Turk, will you stop?
Yes, I've never been a big fan of surgeons. And, yes, I worry about your maturity sometimes I'm a worrier, it's what I do. But you have _got_ to stop trying to pinpoint what the reason is.
'Cause there's so many of them, right? I mean, you don't like who I am...you don't like what I do....
Come on. I like the way I have to stand up on my tippy-toes to kiss you.
It's not enough.
NEW_SCENE
Hey, Elliot, I heard you got your nursing degree in the 'male'...nurse! Wazzaaaaap.
That's her. Don't look!
Murse!
Whoa, Doctor! Hey, I'm not that type of gal.
Shut up, Paul! You are a man! And I am a woman!
Elliot, are you okay?
NEW_SCENE
I got very drunk last night.... And I decided that I'm not giving up on you. So...how'd you do with my counting exercise?
Honestly, I tried it once and I thought it was stupid.
That's it we're done.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. You're dumping _me_?
I hope we can remain friends!

Oh, now, please don't take away the privilege of letting me pay you two hundred dollars an hour so that I can drag my ass in here and watch you nod. God knows the only other place I can get that on the planet is from my Brett Favre bobble-head doll.

Fine. You want to know what I really think? Your problem isn't that you make bad choices, it's that you identify the good choice and then intentionally do the opposite. You see, behind this boorish bravado of yours is a paralyzing fear of letting anyone into your life. And it isn't because you weren't _loved when you were a kid_, it's because you're so ego-centered that the love wasn't enough. So, you pulled pig-tails and you pushed the fat kids into the dirt so no one could ignore little Perry. Well "little Perry" is now forty years old. And you're so invested in this neurotic, narcissistic notion of yourself as "_loner_" that you can't quit. And you'll just keep dumping on everyone around you, until eventually and please, trust me on this there won't be anyone left.
There's a million reasons a relationship can crash and burn....
Boo-hoo-hoo-hoo-hoo-hooooo.... Gimme a break.
Whether it's because you don't have the stones to make it work...
Sorry, I have to...um...cancel tonight.
...or, you just get sick and tired of jumping through hoops.
Okay, you win; all right, you don't have to worry about me asking you over and over anymore.
Eventually, everyone bails.

column2: J.D. comes to the front door and knocks
column3: knock, knock-knock, knock, knock...
Two bits.
If it isn't my favorite career counselor. You wouldn't happen to have any more tips on how to climb _down_ the ladder, would ya?
I've been doing some thinking, about how you're always blaming me for everything, and how you just send a constant stream of crap my way...and...I decided I need a break.
So, what'd you come by to tell me you're a complete wuss?
No. I...came over here to tell you that I traded with another resident and switched off your service for a while.

Well, tears-&-hugs, there, Katie. But, unless you want to come inside, here, and give one of the fellas a lap-dance, I'm afraid I gotta say Sayonara, 'cause I got twenty guys in here and it's about to get nutty! All the best, baby.
NEW_SCENE
Turns out, last night got in my head. So, this morning, I swallowed my pride and asked Dr. Gross to take me back.
The Shrink's Office
I have a hammer in my desk.
...It...did not go well.
Uh, Dr. Cox. I was the one who switched with J.D.
Nervous Guy.... How you feeling?
A little nervous.
Oh, that's okay. Don't worry about a thing, 'cause I'm gonna ease you in. Here's the deal: You have exactly eight seconds to find this patient's chart or you're through here.
God! Chart? Chart? Anyone?
You want me to look for it?
Did anyone see a chart?!
Nah, I got the chart right here.
Agh! Chart!?!
NEW_SCENE
Cheer-up hug?
What?
Well, when I was little, and something made me sad, my mom would always have the maid give me a cheer-up hug.
Ahhh, further explaining your love of the Latino people.
Carla, whenever you need to talk....
You know, it's just that I don't think that Turk is being fair. He didn't get the answer that he wanted when he wanted it, so now he's pushing
What do you want?
Okay, wait, wait, wait. Now, are you kissing me because you actually want this to go somewhere, or because you feel bad about blowing me off yesterday?
NEW_SCENE
Actually, I don't care either way.
NEW_SCENE
I just had to bail on Cox for a while, you know? I mean, the guy sees a shrink every day, and he's still the biggest pain in my ass.
Is he in group?
A Small Room
Maybe it's not everybody else maybe it's you.
Yeah.
Uh-huh.
Good sharing.
I see your point.
That's right.
Mm-hmm.
Anybody got anything else?
Yeah, I've got one.
Come here!
I don't think he'd do well in group. So, uh, what's up with Carla?
I'm starting to think that if she really loved me I'd know by now. Maybe it's time to retreat, protect myself, so I don't get hurt any worse. I really don't want to talk about it, though.
Sure.
Here you go, fellas.
Thank you, Jenny.
You're welcome!
Ahhh, eight strips of bacon! That girl is all _about_ the J.Dizzle.
Oh, yeah?
Oh, my God, it's pancake man.
That's what I'm talkin' 'bout.
NEW_SCENE
Keep it together, there, pee-pants. You now have six seconds to find that soda you were holding for me.
Has anyone seen a soda? Oh, for the love of God!
What is it, there, Bobbo.
I'm sorry.
What did you say?
I spoke to my cardiologist, and he said if you hadn't caught my high blood-pressure, and it had continued unchecked, it, uh, might have resulted in a mild case of....death.
Must...fight urge...to rub it...in his face!
Anyway, I owe you one.
Must...rub something...in...someone's...face!!
How's that coma going for ya, there, pal?
Much better!
NEW_SCENE
I'll bet you never made out in there before.
NEW_SCENE
No, never!
Come here.
Nurse, I need...clean sheets right away to room one....thousand.
Uh, she's covering because she's embarrassed that she likes a nurse. And I really can't figure out why.
Well, that's because you're doing a woman's job, son. Have a good one.
Great. Why did you do that?
You know, Elliot, what I do for a living, it doesn't make me feel like I'm any less of a man. Neither does my love of baking...or gardening...or the fact that I occasionally menstruate.
_What_?!
Elliot, lighten up. Stop worrying so much about what everybody else thinks.
NEW_SCENE
Go ahead. I'll see you outside.
Okay.
Boy, I gotta say, your wife is hotter than I _ever_ imagined. ArrrrrrrrRRRRrrr...me-ow!
Hello, Perry. You're obviously trying to bully me, but you can't bully me because I don't fear you. Now, I'm leaving.
Kelso asked me to give him a physical, I did it, he said "thank you" and told me he owed me one.
You _actually_ made a decision that benefited your life personally and professionally?
Well, a resident kinda talked me into it.
Yeah, come on, you're telling me that _you_ took the advice of another human being.
It's a great moment for me.
Congratulations.

Thank you. And Perry, if there's someone in your life at that hell-hole of a hospital who you actually listen to, you should do everything in your power to keep them around. Because that person is nothing short of a genius.
Everybody was kung-fu fighting! "Those cats were fast as lighten "
Bat Cave.
Hi, yeah, I'm stuck in the elevator?
Yeah.... I'm afraid it might be a little while.
Because you did this!
Aw, now, I think we both know you did this to yourself. Well, I'll let you go.
Hello?
NEW_SCENE
Hey, Laverne, have you seen Turk around?
He's off today, Honey. How come you don't know that?
I don't know....
Listen up everybody! I appreciate solidarity, but I did not blow off Paul because he's a nurse; so, please stop leaving bedpans in my locker it makes me cry. Paul and I are just...different, okay.

Please, Elliot, this is not about Paul.... This is about you! This is about you not being able to commit, because committing means saying goodbye to whatever unfulfilled fantasy of love you've concocted after seeing too many Meg Ryan movies. But men don't come and make everything all better they're only human. And you shouldn't punish him because you were forced to grow up so fast you never learned how to let someone else take care of you. He's not your father, okay, he's not necessarily gonna disappear at the first sign of trouble. And, as scary as it is to consider letting yourself be truly vulnerable with another human being, what's even scarier is that deep down inside you know you picked this man...and if you run away from him now, you'll be running away from being the kind of person you always wanted to be.
Carla, I...just met the guy!
All right, here we go, baby; here we go.
Are you talking to your chili dog!?
What? Hey!
Uh, yeah well, I find that they don't repeat on me as much if I'm real friendly to 'em.
Oh.
What?

Nothing, it's just it's just weird seeing you out in the real world, you know, I feel kind of guilty. 'Cause you're so nice to me and my buddy, and we've never even had a real conversation. Instead, we act like school kids and argue over who we think you got a crush on.
Oh, it's totally you.
Wha ?
Vanilla over chocolate? Please.
NEW_SCENE
In the event of a water landing....
Yeahp. Incoming.
How you doing.
Did you just climb down an elevator shaft to torment me?
Well, sometimes in life you gotta do what you gotta do.
Look, I promise you the "door open" button was not working.
Mm-hmm. No, it's okay. We're gonna be able to work this thing out, seriously.
Put your hands together like you're praying.
Oh, hey, Dr. Cox! Good to see you!
Oh, what the hell, he's a decent kid. Be a man and apologize to him, from the heart for once.
Oh, for God's sake, Lilly, stop being such a complete wuss and come back to work with me!
Fine.
Good.
Oh, just give him a pat on the back he's been wanting it since day one.
Just do it!
The second that Dr. Cox patted me on the shoulder, I thought about how he always shows up in the nick of time.
Hey, I'll hang on to this!
I guess, in the end, everything comes down to timing.
Sometimes, you just have one moment to seize it.
Paul. I know that I've been acting like an insecure idiot, but...if you'll forgive me, I'd love to take you for dinner tonight.
Screw that. I'll cook for you.
I've only got one apron, though; so, bring your own if you want to wear one.
Hmmm!
Oh, please. You all wish you could bag a nurse.
She's right.
Shut up, Zeltzer!
You shut up.
And if your timing is good, and it works out for you, make sure you cherish it. Because bad timing can mess up everything.
You wanna grab a cup of coffee?
I don't know.... Uhhh....
I'll let you talk to it before you drink it...?
Okay. I can get one cup of coffee.
One cup?
One cup. Sure.
Oh, one second. Let me just answer this real quick.
Hello?
Ask me again.
Uhh...sorry, but...I gotta go.
What?
NEW_SCENE
Wooo-hoooo!
NEW_SCENE
I still can't believe you guys are getting married!
I know! All my girlfriends think I'm crazy......about you! Because you're so damn cute!
Good save.
Thank you very much for coming out tonight, guys.
Oh, come on, this is the only way to celebrate, right? With close friends...and...Nurse Roberts....
Oh, hey, now, don't get all pissy now. You said "My treat, order whatever you want." You didn't say "order whatever you want except the lobster."
I said "no shellfish."
I wasn't really mad. This was great except for one thing.
Hey, you can't celebrate without beer.
You're absolutely right!
Sure, Paul was dating Elliot. But, luckily, I'm not the jealous type.
Okay, I'll, uh, I'll go ahead and and make a little toast, here. Uh, a toast that only people that've known...Turk and Carla more than a week will understand. You guys rock. You do.
How's that taste, Blondie!

You guys, you know, I've just gotten to know you as a couple, but you remind me of my grandparents. They were married for sixty-five years, and every night before Grandpa and Grandma would walk around the block, he would look deep into her eyes as if to say, "I'd follow you anywhere." Anyway, the way you two just looked at each other, I could have sworn I was looking at them.
Lame! This guy.
NEW_SCENE
Morning, Dr. Kelso.
Dr. Dorian, how is it this whole hospital gets up in arms every time our MRI machine misses a tumor, but every morning our lousy coffee machine spits out warm urine and nobody gives two hoots!?
We missed another tumor?
Who cares! The point is, I have to go across the street to get coffee! Piping-hot coffee that puts a hop in your step and your ass in the john.
I just wish I really knew why it hurt so much right here.
Well, Mr. Simms, it could be because it's damp out. It could also be because, four days ago, I sliced your chest open with a giant knife. You had surgery, buddy, you'll be fine.
Hey, Dr. Dorian, I have a couple of minutes off. Would you like me to show you that technique I was telling you about?
Yes, Doctor.
See, now, what you want to do is choke up on the club like this? And then hit this bad boy like a baseball!
You can't teach that.
No you cannot, my friend. No you cannot!
So, what was up with Mr. Simms back there?
Ahhh, during his open-lung biopsy, I accidentally nicked his intercostal artery, and now he's got a hematoma.
Are you gonna tell him?
What, and risk a lawsuit? Are you crazy? Besides, it'll heal just fine, anyway. Hey, throw me another ball.
Yeah, but...don't you believe in bad karma?
No!
Hot cuppa lava, coming through.
Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaggggggggggggggggggggggghhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!
I dunno. Me, I think karma keeps the universe in order.
Karma, schmarma. Now listen, if you're not getting the length on the drive that you need, a lot of the better pros take a running start.
Righty-o.
NEW_SCENE
In medicine, you get used to seeing a lot of horrible things.
Morning, sport.
Oh, my God! Do _not_ say "splotchy."
Good splotchy, Dr. Splotchy.
Oh, please, it's barely noticeable.
Ohhh! Dark Roast!
Dammit!
There she is! Are you ready to be born today! Jeebeedeebeejeebee....
Get the hell away from my stomach, or I'll put you in a leg-lock and snap your little bird-neck with my enormous thighs.
Enjoy your special day.
Thanks.

Now, in honor of this little goblin's arrival, I have gone ahead and taken care of everything: Dr. Gerson will be _waiting_ to induce you; she will also administer the world's largest epidural. I have wealthily under-qualified residents covering all of my patients, so that I can be with you every step of the way. And, here's the kicker: I have traded every single one of my weekends, I have called in every favor, and I have kissed every pompous, wrinkled ass in this fluorescent hell-hole, so that I could secure for you the one and only mack-daddy, out-of-your-mind birthing suite in this entire hospital!
Nice job, Alice.
NEW_SCENE
Hey, Paul.
What are you doing down here?
Oh, I just need a nurse to help me out.
Hey, this name-tag says Paul Flowers, Nurse not Paul Flowers, Elliot Reid's Boyfriend. Now, what do you need?
Mr. Mahoney threw up on himself. He needs a bath.
Hey, uh, Dina, my girlfriend's got a job for you!
Uh, right!
Paul, um...I just want you to know I am having such a good time with you.
Me too.
Hey, sorry I didn't call you last night, I just totally crashed.
No big deal.
See, I love that you don't let the little things bother you. Like, right now, you've got pit stains, and you're just like, "Whatever! I'm workin' hard!"
What can I say? I'm an easy-going gal!
Oh, my God! Oh, my God! I need deodorant and a dry top over here!
NEW_SCENE
Doctors love to use humor.
Well, Mr. Foster, your blood tests are back, and the good news is you're not pregnant.
'Cause you're.... 'Cause you're a.....
J.D. is a stand-up comedian.
I said, "Not pregnant." Is this thing on? And hey! What is the deal with Q-Tips? They're not Qs, and they're not tips!
Uhhh, but unfortunately, the CAT-scan suggests a laceration in your spleen, which is why I asked for a surgical consult. So, how'd this happen, anyway?
A golf ball hit my windshield, and I drove into a tree.
Mmm?
NEW_SCENE
Okay, here's the deal: You are, in fact, supposed to be up in the mack-daddy suite, but the woman who's in there is in her fortieth hour of labor.
Did you explain to her that it is _my_ room?
I started to, but then she screamed, grunted, and pooped on the table. God , it always cracks me up that they never tell pregnant women to expect that one!
I'm going to _poo_ in front of people!?
No.... Yeah!
We are so done talking!
Don't tease me.
Where's Dr. Gerson?
She's up in that room with the woman.
Then who the hell's gonna take care of me!?
She's sending her resident.
Hey, happy couple! Hi! I'm Donna Brulatti, but you can call me...Dr. Donna!
NEW_SCENE
Carla, you know how I'm...really crazy?
Sure, what's up?
It's just getting so hard to hide the crazy from Paul.
Oh, I hear you, girl. I mean, Turk and I are engaged ?
Mm-hmm?
and it wasn't until last week that I admitted the reason I don't touch the seat when I go to the bathroom isn't because of germs but because I'm afraid of toilet snakes.
Aaaaand now so am I.
Look, I think, with men, you just have to hold out until they're invested enough they won't run away at the first thing that spooks them.
I know.... And, with Paul, I really feel like we're getting pretty close right now!
So...you guys have...?
Not yet, but tonight's our fourth date, so....
Four dates?
Yeah, it's one date longer than the sluts, one date shorter than the prudes. I am Four-Date Reid!
Yeah, but, what about that surgeon the other
I'm Four-Date Reid!
Hey, Cutie! Hey! You ready for our third date?
_Fourth_ date! You're forgetting about the time we ran into each other at the coffee machine. You shut up! Hi!
What the hell am I doing playing golf!? This is all Tiger Woods' fault.
This guy's gonna sue the hospital, we're gonna get fired, we'll have to become male whores.
Very successful male whores we'll probably have a nicer apartment and some bling-bling, but male whores nonetheless!
Relax, all right? Nobody knows about this but us. We'll be fine.
Hey, guys! Check out the personalized golf club cozy I found on the roof!
Hi, Davey!
You and your stupid Christmas present!
Yeah.... Seems like one of the golf balls you hit went through the windshield of my van. No big deal, I just expect you to replace it, that's all.
Wait, wait, wait. Your your windshield's been broken for like a year!

Yeah! Yeah, I know. Still. "Oh, no! Looks like we're in a...pickle! Pick pick pickle!" boogida-boogida-boogida-boogida-boogida-boogida-boogida-boogida-boo Pop! Here's the keys, have it back by tomorrow. Who're you?
Dr. Turk.
I don't care.
NEW_SCENE
I'm not gonna lie to you, there, Bob; I have not been having the greatest day.
Perry, I just drew in this eyebrow five minutes ago, so cry me a river.
Anyway, Jordan and I got stuck in this crappy room, and I was wondering if....if....whoo, well....
Perry, if you want a favor, don't beat around the bush. Just...curtsy.
I beg your pardon, there, Backdraft?
You heard what I said. Well?
Always remember how I made you do that.
Ha ha ha! Oh!
NEW_SCENE
Hey, fellas! Always nice to have visitors! So, uh, what's the dealio?
Ted.... How bad would it really be if, uh, two doctors were hitting golf balls off the roof and they caused a car accident and the driver needed surgery?
Ted?
Hey, fellas! Always nice to have visitors! So, what's the dealio?
No dealio, Ted, we just stopped by to say "Hi." ...Hi.
See you later, buddy.
Later!
We both knew what we had to do.
Let's come clean.
Let's not tell anyone! Ever! Ever, ever, ever, ever, ever, ever! EVER!
Ever?
Ever!
I guess it's hard to predict how a person will react.
So...you wanna come in?
No, it's okay. I'll see you tomorrow.
Well, then, Jordan, why don't we just think of today as as a test run.
Other times, people react exactly how you think they will.

Honestly, Perry, the only way I could have felt more taken care of is if I were at a four-star resort, or a spa...or a third-world country where you have to boil your own sewage if you want something to drink! Oh, and by the way? A giant, giant feather in your cap for how much power you wield in this hospital after 15 years.

Come on, come on, come on, Jordan. I am so sorry everything fell apart today, honest-to-God, I am. But I guarantee that when you get here tomorrow, Dr. Gerson will, in fact, be in the super-deluxe birthing suite so that you can go ahead and have that story-book, drug-addled, Pitocin-induced pregnancy that you've always dreamed of ever since you were a little girl. But, in the meantime, you've gotta cut me a little slack. I mean, come on, it's not like I see the real father running around here, busting his hump.
Ohh, that's nice. I'm going home.
No, no you're not.
Bye-bye!
Jordan, your water just broke.
This kid's annoying me already.
NEW_SCENE
I think having babies is so much fun! Don't you!
I will choke her.
Please, Dr. Brulatti, no more talking.
Oh, you know, I really prefer "Dr. Donna"!
No means no, pep-squad. Now beat it.
And, Jordan, I am not gonna leave your side until that baby is delivered.
Get the hell out of here.
What?
I'm serious. Why don't you do us both a favor and get out.
...Fine.
It's important to stay positive!
GET ME AN EPIDURAL BEFORE I RIP YOUR TEETH OUT!
Okie-dokie!
Hey, Girl's Name!
What?

Gimme a break I got a lot on my mind, Ellen! Ooh! Look at that! I bounced back! A-hey-anyway, the cave bat just kicked me out of its lair, and seeing as I no longer have my all-access pass to crazy town, I'm going to need you to occasionally go in there and poke her with a broomstick, just to see how she's doing.
Dr. Cox
Uh-buh-buh-buh-buh-buh! Please! Just...check on her, 'kay? All right.
But what if she has the baby while I'm in there?
The Birthing Suite
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGHHHHHHHHHHHHH!
Here it comes!
What the hell is that?
Goo-goo, ga-ga! Ga-ga, goo-goo! Goo-goo! Gee-gee! Agh!
AAAGGGHHH!! GAH! Oh, somebody get it off!!!!!!
I'll check on her later!
NEW_SCENE
Elliot, wait up. Elliot.
Hey.
I wanted to explain about last night. We had a great time, and I know that you wanted me to come in to...you know....
Oh, no, no, no! I invited you in to see my...fish tank.
Is that what you ladies are calling it nowadays?
Careful, Todd.
Sorry, Nurse Flowers, sir.

Elliot, listen, I think you're an amazing girl, I really do. But...something just didn't feel right about last night. It's just that I've rushed things with people in the past, and I don't want to do that with you.
What does he mean "in the past"? Does he have an ex-girlfriend? Is that her? Slut!
I feel the same way. Heh.
Hey!
Oh, I am on to you.
Go on. Heh.
NEW_SCENE
So, now...why'd you finally agree to marry Gandhi?
Well, he's amazing in bed...and he has an awesome CD collection.
Seriously, what got you to the point where you weren't scared anymore?
Please! I'm still terrified! I mean, good luck finding a pen cap at the nurses' station. Know why?
Why?
Ate 'em all.
Sounds like good roughage to me.
What do you do when you get scared?
Run away, get a divorce, drink alone.... You know, the classics. The thing is that, this time, I am killing myself for this woman, and I'm still getting my ass handed to me.
There is no Shangri-La, you know? Every relationship is messed up. What makes it perfect is if you still want to be there when things really suck.
Yeah, well, I'm not so sure.
It'll come to you.
NEW_SCENE
